channel.title: Looking for a recording program?
channel.description:
So I'm looking for a good recording program that can record guitar plugged from my amp into the PC and maybe handle computer drums put over the top, I'm downloading Adobe Audition at the moment, just wondering if anyone had any suggestions?
EDIT: Found a drum program named Hydrogen, no idea how to insert the beats into Audition though :x

item.title: Looking for a recording program?
item.dc:creator: Deimos
item.description:
Guf:

Audition is good (used to be CoolEdit 2000), and does multichannel, so I’d imaging exporting the output of the beats as wave files then importing them into Audition would work fine.
Quality will in the end depend on your sound card too tho.

Yeah I’ve got a pretty new Soundblaster card for my 5.1 surround sound speakers. Tried it out last night, pretty awesome and will get what I need to do done.

Thanks guys.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for a recording program?
item.dc:creator: Gizmo
item.description:
Sony Sound Forge 10 pro if your looking for multichannels and quality filters

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for a recording program?
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
For just recording, audacity is pretty good. It’s free (legally) and isn’t bloated.

Read full topic
